alert.note: Alert for Orangeburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 23 at 3:58PM EST until January 27 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... North Fork Edisto River At Orangeburg affecting Orangeburg County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in South Carolina... Stevens Creek Near Modoc affecting Edgefield and McCormick Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING TO EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Fork Edisto River At Orangeburg. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening to early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Some minor flooding occurs along the boardwalk at Edisto Gardens. Downstream from the Highway 301 bridge, some roads off Chiquita street near the river begin to flood. At 10.0 feet, Farmland and lowlands along Highway 301 near Orangeburg become flooded at stages above 10 ft. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM EST Monday the stage was 7.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow evening to a crest of 8.1 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
